title: how can we use this client to connect globalprotect vpn?
body:
palo  alto (globalprotect) vpn is using ssl/tls protocol, how can we use client to connect it ?
i tried with client command, but seems i cannot make connection to server

im on OSX 10.14.4
author: ilovefood2

comments.body: globalprotect seem to be proprietary SSL vpn, not compatible with SE VPN
ask those guys are they compatible or not ?

> globalprotect seem to be proprietary SSL vpn, not compatible with SE VPN

im sure it's proprietary, but they should accept third-party clients i think. for instance, OpenConnect v8 integrated globalprotect protocol
do they accept SE VPN clients as well ?
Hmmm I’m not sure

title: is possible to use softether in different tabs with the same browser with different ip's in each tab?
body: is possible to use softether in different tabs with the same browser with different ip's in each tab?
author: axe-usat

comments.body: No. You can only create one VPN per Computer

title: A few questions
body:
1. How to change the preset vpn: preshared key name and other moments.
2. How to get rid of dnsleaks? Use dnsmasq on the host machine, you can tell by the settings then.
3. Can I do it and if I can do it better: Double / Triple / Quad bundle for VPN
4. How to change ports to others? How to change ports if VPN is already installed on the server? Where to look ?

In advance I thank for answers
author: canusuck

comments.body:
1. I don't have a GUI right now, but you can change the preshared key on vpncmd via the command "IPsecEnable"
2. I don't understand the question? What do you want to achieve??
3. Currently there is no support as far as I know
4. For L2TP you can not. For OpenVPN you can change port from GUI or vpncmd. Further sstp is supported over 443. For SE own protocol you can also use any port. Also it is possible to use dns or icmp for creating a vpn connection
@canusuck If you are happy with this answer, I'd like to close this ticket

title: Change Server Protocol from UDP to TCP
body:
How to change the server protocol from UDP to TCP protocol?

thank you
author: anwareset

comments.body:
What do you mean by server protocol? SoftEther supports both TCP and UDP connections. 

If you are using vpngate and you append "/tcp" to the server's name it will connect using tcp. 

Does this answer your question?
I prefer to UDP than TCP because of NAT and firewalls
OP did not answer in a while.  Closing this issue.

title: Clustermode and L2TP/OpenVPN
body:
Hi,

Why it is not possible to have L2TP/(IPSec) and OpenVPN available in Cluster mode ?
Also MSSTP are not available in Cluster Mode.

Regards,
bofh-zp
author: bofh-zp

comments.body: Technically impossible as those protocols do not support clustering.

I'm closing this issue because many things changed regarding the build system.

Feel free to reply in case you're still experiencing the issue.

title: How to distribute routes
body:
I am trying to setup a site to site VPN. Once the site-to-site VPN is established, I want the VPN Server (using SoftEther VPN) to broadcast a route in that subnet (it is required to setup a route in that network such that all the PCs start sending the traffic to that VPN server for a particular route.

I heard this can be done through Quaaga. Has anyone done it? Any pointers please?

Thanks...Pete
author: petergsnm

comments.body: This is irrelevant to SE. You can use scripts and DHCP server to achieve that.

title: Where can I assign a static IP to vpn users?
body:
I want to set up like this: PC1,PC2,PC3 -> SEVPNserver(123.123.123.123/wan IP)

I don't want to connect SEVPNserver's network(lan IP 10.10.50.X range)
but I want to connect to SEVPNserver itself / VPN users.

ex.
SEVSERVER 10.10.20.1
PC1(vpn connected) 10.10.20.22
PC1(vpn connected) 10.10.20.27

[ALLOW]
10.10.20.22 -> 10.10.20.1:8080 = 127.0.0.1:8080(in server side)
10.10.20.22 -> 10.10.20.1:465 = 127.0.0.1:465(in server side)
10.10.20.22 -> 10.10.20.27 (pc-to-pc)
10.10.20.22 -> 120.130.140.150 (to internet, just like a router)

[DENY]
10.10.20.22 -> 10.10.50.25

The question is,
1. Where can I set a static IP for each VPN user? (ex. 10.10.20.x range for VPN)
2. If can't, should I use SecureNAT's DHCP instead?

server has 2 NIC card.
one is 10.10.1.2 WAN(Global IP: 123.123.123.123)
second is 10.10.50.1 LAN
author: ghost

comments.body:
1. If you are using VPN Client, you can use your own DHCP server to assign static IP addresses to each computer, by using unique virtual MAC addresses of VPN clients.
2. You can also define access-list entries on the Virtual Hub. An entry can have the username field as the matching condition. Then you can allow the specific access to the specific user.

So there's no option to force user to use assigned IP address.
User(client) can change their vpn IP address to anything. Wow.

PC1: VPN IP: 10.10.20.22 | PC2: VPN IP: 10.10.20.222
PC1 disconnected -> PC2 change its IP address to .22 -> Connect to the VPN as PC1

Isn't this a positive attack?
It'll be more secure if I can assign an vpn IP address to each user in "manage Virtual Hub - Manage Users" section
and filter(drop) everything when the user change its IP address to non-assigned one.
You can force the user to use DHCP-assigned IP address by enabling the Enforce DHCP Allocated IP Addresses (IPv4) policy.
The question was answered correctly. The user does not exist anymore on github. I'd like to close this issue.
Why did you open a new issue?

title: Implementation of QOS
body:
I think that implementing bandwith and traffic limitations on virtual hub and/or users could be usefull. 
Thankyou for all the work already done
author: ghost

comments.body: Closing in favor of #1389

title: Solaris: use DLPI style 1 attachment and check for /dev/net used by Illumos and Solaris 10+.
body:
Changes proposed in this pull request:
 - Switch from DLPI style 2 to DLPI style 1 attachment, based on opening network device (/dev/bge0) rather than root device (/dev/bge)
 - Prefer devices located in /dev/net, if present, which is used by Illumos and Solaris 10+
 - Should allow SoftEther to work properly with vanity nics and Crossbow vnics present on Solaris 10+ and Illumos while retaining compatibility with older Solaris versions (provided that network interface has its own device node).

You may use this patch as necessary (contribution option 1).
author: hww3

comments.body: Hi @hww3  and thanks for your contribution. I don't have any solaris hardware around. Do you have any tips on how I can test your PR ??

Hi!

I tested the patch on a VM running OpenIndiana... I used VMWare but I've used VirtualBox in the past. That should let you test against a "physical" interface as well as a vnic. I can dig up the commands I used to set up a vnic for testing if that would be helpful. The configuration I used was actually copied from one I used on a linux box; the only change I made was the network interface name.

I'm happy to help provide guidance for testing... just let me know how I can help!
I tested the patch on SmartOS and it looks to be working fine.
What extra info/data would be needed to eventually get this merged?
is there something like travis-ci with Solaris ?
I don't believe travis offers a solaris build environment. The closest equivalent would be to install something like jenkins on a solaris system...

am I right that only "OpenEthSolaris" function is affected? so, linux, etc are not affected by this patch?

if so, I guess we can merge it.


can you please resolve merge conflict ?
Yes, that function is only used on Solaris based systems, so it should not impact other platforms. I will take a look at the merge conflict...
I rebased against `master` and fixed the code style.

I think we can merge it.

no ready CI for solaris (like travis-ci).
if solaris folks wish, they can setup jenkins, for example.
no other subsystem (except solaris) is affected
Thank you very much for your contribution!

title: Radius does not work from second Hub
body:
Tuned the same Radius Server for 2 Virtual Hub

When I connect via SSTP to default Hub using simple username ALL fine.
When I connect via SSTP to default Hub using username@hub I get Radius reject
When I connect via SSTP to second Hub using username@hub2 even request to Radius does not send.

Listened by tcpdump on Radius interface.
author: Delagen

comments.body: I've tested this and it works as expected with multiple hubs to same radius server.

You can try EAP if the radius server supports, with #1775 
It's hard to fix it with MSCHAPv2 only.
Might be duplicate of #1103
